Hello! I'm GovConnect Assistant, your helpful AI assistant for Sri Lankan government services. Here's how you can get a new National Identity Card (NIC) if you've lost your old one:

1. Normal Service Applications:
   - Forward your application through the Grama Niladhari.
   - The new NIC will be sent to you by post.

2. One-Day Service:
   - Visit the Head Office in Battaramulla or the Galle Provincial Office with the completed application.
   - You will receive your new NIC on the same day.

If you have any other questions about government services in Sri Lanka, feel free to ask! I'm here to help.

For more information, please visit the following links:
- National Identity Card (NIC) services: https://www.gov.lk/nic/
- Motor Vehicle Registration Charges: https://www.gov.lk/motor-vehicle-registration-charges/
- Other services: https://www.gov.lk/other-services/
- Issuance of National Identity Cards for Dual Citizens: https://www.gov.lk/issuance-of-national-identity-cards-for-dual-citizens/
- How to Obtain a New National Identity Card for a Lost One: https://www.gov.lk/how-to-obtain-a-new-national-identity-card-for-a-lost-one/

If you need further assistance, feel free to contact the relevant government department directly.

Best regards,
GovConnect Assistant.

Hello! I am here to help you with government services in Sri Lanka. Here are some of the services I can assist you with:

1. First-Time Registration of a Motor Vehicle in Sri Lanka: This guide outlines the process for the first-time registration of a motor vehicle in Sri Lanka. You can find the application form, required documents, and the application process here.

2. National Identity Card (NIC) services:
   - One-Day Service: The One-Day Service is available for individuals who urgently need a National Identity Card (NIC). This service is offered at the Head Office of the Department of Registration of Persons and the Galle Provincial Office. To use this service at the Head Office, applicants must visit Terminal D on the 9th floor between 7:30 AM and 12:30 PM.
   - National Identity Cards for Dual Citizens: The procedure for dual citizens to obtain a National Identity Card (NIC) differs based on the section of the Citizenship Act under which dual citizenship was granted.
   - Issuance of NICs for deceased persons: The NICs of deceased persons must be surrendered to the Department for Registration of Persons or the Divisional Secretariat, as per Registration of Persons Regulation No. 16 of 2017.

3. Motor Vehicle Registration Charges: This document provides a comprehensive breakdown of the fees and penalties associated with the first-time registration of various motor vehicles in Sri Lanka.

4. Other services: The department will conduct a formal investigation and take action to resolve issues related to NICs, such as complaints about incorrect information (e.g., different dates of birth, names) or tampered cards. The department's data system is linked to the Sri Lanka Police. The Police conduct clearances and forward problematic applications to the department, where issues are resolved before clearance is granted.

If you have any questions or need further assistance, please let me know!

To register a motor vehicle in Sri Lanka for the first time, you will need to complete the MTA-2 application form, which can be obtained free of charge at the Head Office and District Secretariats. You will also need to submit the following documents:
- Two 2.0 x 2.5 inch photographs of the vehicle owner
- A photocopy of the owner's National Identity Card, driving license, or valid passport, with a Grama Niladhari certificate for the address
- Customs entry (Custom 53) and original receipts for customs duty payments

You can submit the required documents to the relevant registration branch at the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) Head Office in Narahenpita, Colombo 05, between 9:00 AM and 1:30 PM on working days. Note that only motor bicycles can be registered at the DMT branch of District Secretariats.

For more information on motor vehicle registration charges, please refer to the document titled "Motor Vehicle Registration Charges." If you have any questions or need further assistance, please contact the Department of Motor Traffic.

Contact information:
Department of Motor Traffic (DMT)
Head Office
Narahenpita, Colombo 05
Phone: +94 11 269 1990
Website: [www.dmt.gov.lk](http://www.dmt.gov.lk)
